moves.1. d4 f6: ? This is terrible, not only does it take no control of the center it opens up the infamous diagonal.
moves.2... e5: ? This is odd, but if I take his pawn then he can't recapture for fear of Qh5+
moves.3. dxe5 fxe5: ?? Uh oh I think you know what's coming.
moves.4. Qh5+ g6 5. Qxe5+ Qe7 6. Qxh8: And his rook drops off. In almost all the games I've played where I win his rook like this it is a fast game where I win quickly instead of just exchanging off material and coming into a won endgame.
moves.7. Ne2: If I blocked with my bishop that would allow Qxg2.
moves.7... Bb4+ 8. Bd2 Kf8: Odd that he didn't exchange off his bishop for mine I mean I know he's behind but I think it would have been better to exchange.
moves.9. Nbc3: ! This breaks the pin on my DSB and attacks his queen.
moves.9... Qxc2: I knew he could do that, but from now on he'll move nothing but his king.
moves.10. Bh6+ Kf7 11. Qg7+: I'm looking for a mating net.
moves.11... Ke8 12. Qxg8+ Ke7: Now his DSB is blocked so...
moves.13... Ke6: Hmm, looks like there's nothing better than Qxc8 as Nd4+ doesn't win his queen because my queen is attacked. Then I noticed
moves.14. Nd4+: ! That this is good after all.
moves.14... Ke5 15. Bg7#: And...Checkmate! I liked this game and would appreciate comments and a rating.
